projects.title: GoWatchIt: Superwidget
projects.description: A pioneering API-backed embeddable SDK and theming engine for film releases, TV programming, and advertising campaigns. Served millions of times a month across the web from major studio properties (Universal, Sony, Paramount, FOX) to large content sites (NYTimes, Buzzfeed, Entertainment Weekly).

projects.title: GoWatchIt: Consumer Site
projects.description: Fully responsive consumer web application  Redesign of existing outdated website through managing stakeholders, freelancers, and team members

projects.title: GoWatchIt: Dashboard
projects.description: Fully featured content management system (CMS) for film and TV studios. Real-time analytics, custom reporting, and visual asset creation and theming (think Google Analytics and Squarespace for film/TV releases)

projects.title: DueProps: Branding and Redesign
projects.description: An HR management app for employee recognition started by (in)famous Ruby and Rails developer and author Obie Fernandez.

projects.title: Flatiron School: Branding
projects.description: Fledgling coding bootcamp needed to make its mark. I worked as Campus Director in the inaugural cohort, handling admissions, events, employer outreach, marketing, social media â€” and yes, branding.

projects.title: Wetfeet: Grad Report
projects.description: Wetfeet, owned by Universum, had exclusive survey data gathered from hundreds of thousands exiting college students around the world. This interactive report profiled the student and let him or her visualize their results.

projects.title: Wetfeet: Culture Fit Prototype
projects.description: This prototype, subsequently released publicly to college graduates, asked the user a series of polling questions. It matched the prospective job seekers with employer cultures through a basic use of machine learning and a social graph API.

projects.title: Breed Breakdown
projects.description: An interactive tool to help the new dog owner find the perfect breed based on their ideal preferences.

projects.title: Guess Who
projects.description: At Ad School (art school for the brand advertising industry), my friends and I made true-to-life versions of Guess Who composed of students and faculty at the school.

projects.title: Miscellany
projects.description: Things that don't fit nicely elsewhere. Logos, type treatments, old resume iterations, etc.
